It is from the strange, alien realms that are revealed which they draw even greater power, shattering all limits no matter the eldritch consequences.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Knowledge
entries: In your study of proscribed power, you learn {@language Deep Speech|PHB} or another language of your choice.
In addition, choose a 1st-level spell from the warlock spell list. You add it to your spellbook if it's not there already, and it is a wizard spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Intrusion
entries: Your search into the forbidden reaches beyond the universe yields great power but comes at the risk of letting something from beyond intrude into your reality.

You have an Intrusion Die, which starts at a {@dice d6}, that can change as you use your features. The die can increase or decrease, along this progression of die sizes: {@dice d2}, {@dice d3}, {@dice d4}, {@dice d6}, {@dice d8}, {@dice d10}, {@dice d12}.

The size maximum for your Intrusion Die is its starting size, which increases by one step when you reach certain levels in this class: 5th level ({@dice d8}), 11th level ({@dice d10}), and 17th level ({@dice d12}).
When you use a feature that risks Intrusion, roll your Intrusion Die. On a 2 or higher, no Intrusion occurs, and the Intrusion die reduces in size one step on the progression.
On a roll of 1, the Intrusion Die rises in size one step, and you roll on the Intrusion table to determine what happens as reality fractures. Intrusions use your spell save DC.

The Intrusion Die increases in size by one step (up to its starting size) when you finish a short rest, and it resets to its starting size when you finish a long rest. Additionally, you can focus alien potency into your spells. When you cast a spell using a spell slot, you can risk Intrusion to choose one of the following.

entries.name: Overwhelming Mind
entries: One target of the spell has disadvantage on the first saving throw made against it.

entries.name: Seeking Eye
entries: You have advantage on the first attack roll you make for the spell.

entries.caption: Intrusion
rows: You feel a presence behind you that whispers incomprehensible things into your soul. Until the end of your next turn, you can only do one of the following on a turn: take an action, a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, or move.

Space twists and melts in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} around you. Each creature (including you) in the area struggles against the warping of reality. An affected creature's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved until the end of your next turn.

The nearest other creature within 60 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take Necrotic damage equal to two rolls of your Intrusion Die (at its starting size), and you regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|PHB} equal to the damage dealt.
Reality tears in your space until the end of your next turn. You and each creature that can see the tear must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition while the tear exists.

One of your arms warps into an alien appendage, such as a distorted version of an arm or a twisting tentacle, for 1 minute. You can make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|PHB|Unarmed Strikes} with the limb using your spell attack bonus. Instead of the normal damage, roll a number of your Intrusion dice (at its starting size) equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. The target takes Acid damage equal to the total rolled.
Alien landscapes overlay your vision, giving you the Blinded condition until the end of your next turn.
Unnatural thoughts disorient you, giving you the Incapacitated condition until the end of your next turn.
You experience an instant of terrible clarity. You take Psychic damage equal to two rolls of your Intrusion Die (at its starting size), and for 1 minute, your spell save DC is increased by 2.
You regain an expended spell slot of level 5 or lower (your choice), and you take Necrotic damage equal to twice the slot's level. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

When you cause this Intrusion and at the end of each of your turns for 1 minute, pulses in the fabric of space fill a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you, giving you and each creature in it the {@condition Prone|PHB} condition.

For 1 hour, you hear whispered, disembodied thoughts of hateful scorn directed at you. While you can hear the whispers, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|PHB} on ability checks and saving throws that rely on Wisdom.

An Aberration or a Fiend with a CR equal to your Wizard level or lower (GM's choice) appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. The GM decides the creature's attitude ({@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|PHB|Hostile}/{@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|PHB|Indifferent}/{@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|PHB|Friendly}) and actions.

subclassFeature.name: Reality Tear
entries: Choose a spell of 3rd level or lower from the warlock spell list. You add the spell to your spellbook if it's not there already, and it is a wizard spell for you. When you cast the spell, you can risk Intrusion to remove the need to {@status Concentration|PHB|Concentrate} on it, and the spell ends after 1 minute or its normal duration, whichever is shorter. Additionally, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to cast the spell once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Occult Presence
entries: When you cause an Intrusion, you can roll twice on the Intrusion table and choose which result to use, and you can negate the Intrusion by gaining 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. Additionally, you gain one of the benefits below, and you can change your chosen benefit when you finish a long rest. As a bonus action, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to change your chosen benefit.

entries.name: Alien Consciousness
entries: You gain immunity to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions, and you can't be possessed.

entries.name: Cosmic Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to necrotic and psychic damage.

entries.name: Spatial Domination
entries: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.

subclassFeature.name: Beyond Space
entries: The nature of distance and location is revealed for the lie that it is. You add the {@spell Scrying} spell to your spellbook, if it's not there already.
When you cast {@spell Scrying}, you can risk Intrusion to choose one of the following.

entries.name: All Knowing
entries: Treat your connection to a target creature as if you have part of its body.

entries.name: All Seeing
entries: Change the spell's casting time to 1 action. When you cast {@spell Scrying}, during the spell's duration, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to teleport yourself, and any willing creatures within 10 feet of you, to unoccupied spaces you can see through the scrying sensor. Once you teleport in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Philosophy
entries: {@i Distill the Essence of Creation}

Philosophys have focused their study of wizardry on the fundamental nature of existence and reality. They seek the most quintessential truths of creation and manipulate those forces and substances through alchemical practice. Through understanding, deconstruction, and reconstruction, they master the natural energies of the world around them and alter it to their will.

Every Wizard who walks the steps of the Philosophy does so to solve some specific problem, even if only at first. The Philosophical Pursuits table offers challenges or goals that set you onto your study of alchemical magic.

entries.caption: Philosophical Pursuits
rows: Someone close to you is lost in time, the planes, or some other esoteric state of being. Unraveling the nature of reality is your path to finding them.
You suffered a debilitating ailment or injury and turned to the study of magic to deconstruct the impairment's nature and transmute it.
Your teacher was killed by a rival Philosophy, and you must learn all you can of that discipline to protect yourself and bring them to justice.
The rediscovered research of a missing mage unlocked the first secrets of your understanding but contains many more you can't yet decipher.
Wizardry provides a path to immense power, but you know an even greater state of being awaits your ascension.
You encountered a material with miraculous properties, and you can't rest until you discover the secret of its creation.
Your sibling's soul was separated from their body in a spell gone wrong, and you cannot forgive yourself until you make them whole.
You were a stage performer who wowed audiences with magical acts, and you seek the ultimate magic trick to become a legend.
You come from an impoverished hometown and wish to utilize the transmutation of metals to bring prosperity to your community.
In your pursuit to be closer to the gods, you have sought the secrets of creating new life forms in your own image.
You were raised to revere the four elements, and you hypothesized that mastering the stuff of existence will bring harmony to them all.
You had aspirations of joining the military and rising through the ranks, believing that the magic of reality can be used as a weapon of war.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Knowledge
entries: You gain a set of {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}. You have proficiency with it and can use it as an arcane focus. Additionally, you can use {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} instead of another tool required to craft a magic item.

subclassFeature.name: Quintessence
entries: You have learned the fundamental process of dissolution. You know the {@spell Dissolution|CrookedMoon24} cantrip. A creature or object you reduce to 0 hit points with the cantrip is destroyed. If the target was Small or larger, it dissolves into a measure (about an ounce) of crystalline powder called Quintessence. You can have a maximum amount of Quintessence equal to twice your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 2 measures) at one time. If you create more, the oldest measure vanishes. You can use Quintessence you are touching in the following ways.

entries.name: Material Component
entries: When you cast a spell, you can expend Quintessence to serve as the spell's material components up to a value of 100 gp per Quintessence expended.

entries.name: Reagent
entries: When you scribe a spell into your spellbook, or when you use {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB} to craft a magic item, you can expend Quintessence to serve as 50 gp worth of material for the task per Quintessence expended.

entries.name: Vitriolic Enhancement
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can expend 1 Quintessence as an additional material component to change one damage type the spell deals to force.

subclassFeature.name: Albedo
entries: You can purify your {@subclassFeature Quintessence|Wizard|PHB|Philosophy|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14} to amplify your spells. When you cast a spell using a spell slot, you can expend 1 {@subclassFeature Quintessence|Wizard|PHB|Philosophy|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14} as a material component to increase the level of the spell slot by 1, up to 9th level. The maximum {@subclassFeature Quintessence|Wizard|PHB|Philosophy|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14} you can expend in this way on a given spell is half of your proficiency bonus (rounded up).

subclassFeature.name: Citrinitas
entries: You can now manipulate {@subclassFeature Quintessence|Wizard|PHB|Philosophy|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14} to create, not merely to purify. You add the {@spell Creation} and {@spell Fabricate} spells to your spellbook if they aren't there already, and you can cast each spell once without expending a spell slot, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you cast a spell using this feature, the casting time becomes 1 action. You can also cast the spells normally using spell slots of the appropriate level.

Additionally, when you cast {@spell Creation}, you can expend a number of {@subclassFeature Quintessence|Wizard|PHB|Philosophy|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14} up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to multiply the spell's duration by 1 plus the amount expended.

subclassFeature.name: Rubedo
entries: The culmination of your great work, you can now distill your perfected knowledge of existence into a physical form. When you finish a short or long rest, you can expend 10 {@subclassFeature Quintessence|Wizard|PHB|Philosophy|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14} to create a Philosophy's stone—a translucent red crystal. The stone is a Tiny magical object with an AC of 18, 20 hit points, and immunity to all damage except force. If you create a second Philosophy's stone, the first one vanishes. While you carry the stone, it grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Amplification
entries: When you cast a spell, you can expend up to 2 {@subclassFeature Quintessence|Wizard|PHB|Philosophy|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14} as an additional material component to increase your spell save DC for that spell by the same amount.

entries.name: Equivalent Exchange
entries: When you fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction to expend 5 {@subclassFeature Quintessence|Wizard|PHB|Philosophy|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14} to succeed on the save instead.

entries.name: Longevity
entries: You stop aging and don't suffer any effects from old age, including dying from it.

entries.name: Sympathy
entries: The stone counts as part of your body for the purpose of the {@spell Scrying} spell and for spells that restore you to life if you die. The stone itself serves as the material component for the spell (if any) and is destroyed when the spell is cast.

subclassFeature.name: Harvest Domain
entries: {@i Sow, Grow, and Reap in the Harvest Cycle}

The Harvest Domain draws from the cycle beginning with creation, reaching abundance, and ending in culling before repeating endlessly. Deities of farming and crops can focus on one of the harvest's aspects, but most draw from each phase of the cycle. Clerics of this domain are drawn to the cyclical nature of existence, and they often take on roles as shepherds of different cycles.
Use the Harvest Rites table for inspiration on observances based on each aspect of the harvest cycle.

entries.caption: Harvest Rites
rows: Bury a sacrificial offering into a newly ploughed field, such as dried corn husks, dead fish, robin's egg, or hare's foot
Brew blessed mixtures and concoctions for consumption or irrigation that increase the fertility of crops, livestock, or people
Gift a pouch of seeds to travelers at the start of a journey to ensure they arrive at their destination
Tend to the sick or injured with natural remedies that utilize pure water, fertile soil, rich ash, or fruit poultice to speed up healing
Bless crops or livestock to usher in favorable weather and a growing season that produces a strong and healthy bounty
Oversee marriages, binding the betrothed with woven grain stalks or linen cords
Give funeral rites that return the deceased's body or ashes to the fields, mixing in earth from their home and decaying crops to enrich the soil
Sharpen blades blessed by the harvest gods ahead of a battle or before a harvest to ensure that all that is reaped is offered to the divine
Slaughter adult livestock or reap ripe crops for a feast to celebrate nature's bounty

subclassFeature.name: Community Almanac
entries: You gain an {@item herbalism kit|PHB}, and you have proficiency with it. You also gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature} or {@skill Survival} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a short or long rest, choose an aspect of the harvest cycle: Sowing, Growing, or Reaping. You gain domain spells listed in the Harvest Domain Spells table for your cycle. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

entries.caption: Harvest Domain Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell Druidcraft|PHB}, {@spell Goodberry|PHB}
{@spell Guidance|PHB}, {@spell Entangle|PHB}
{@spell Chill Touch|PHB}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|PHB}
3rd
{@spell Lesser Restoration|PHB}
{@spell Summer Winds|CrookedMoon14}
{@spell Hold Person|PHB}
5th
{@spell Harvest Moonglow|CrookedMoon14}
{@spell Plant Growth|PHB}
{@spell Culling Sickle|CrookedMoon14}
7th
{@spell Death Ward|PHB}
{@spell Sanctum of the Shepherd|CrookedMoon14}
{@spell Consuming Pyre|CrookedMoon14}
9th
{@spell Awaken|PHB}
{@spell Mass Cure Wounds|PHB}
{@spell Field of Reaping|CrookedMoon14}

subclassFeature.name: Cornucopia
entries: When you start a short rest, you can magically create a cornucopia filled with enough food for a number of creatures equal to twice your proficiency bonus. When creatures that eat the food finish a short rest, you can distribute a number of d4s equal to your cleric level among creatures who ate the food. Each creature immediately rolls the dice they're allotted and regains hit points equal to the total. The cornucopia and any uneaten food vanish when the short rest ends.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Bountiful Harvest
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|PHB|2} to magically invoke the spirit of the harvest. As an action, you present your {@item holy symbol|PHB}, and up to six creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you gain inspiration. A creature must finish a long rest before it can gain inspiration from this feature again.
Additionally, you grant all targets one of the following benefits. If your current harvest aspect is a different one, it changes to match the choice.

entries.name: Sowing
entries: A target gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus plus your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Growing
entries: Until the end of your next turn, when a target makes an attack roll or ability check, it adds {@dice 1d4} to the total.

entries.name: Reaping
entries: A target deals extra necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus the first time it damages a creature before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Seasons
entries: You can draw upon the powers of the harvest cycle to potentially avert disaster. When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw of a particular type determined by your current aspect, you can use your reaction to allow it to reroll the {@dice d20} and use the new roll. The type of saving throws you can affect are as follows.

entries.name: Sowing
entries: Dexterity and Charisma

entries.name: Growing
entries: Constitution and Intelligence

entries.name: Reaping
entries: Wisdom and Strength
Additionally, after the saving throw succeeds or fails, roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus. The target regains hit points equal to the total rolled.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Wheel
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Channel Divinity: Bountiful Harvest|Cleric|PHB|Harvest|CrookedMoon14|2|CrookedMoon14}, you can invoke the endless cycle of life, death, and rebirth to grant yourself and the creatures affected by your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|PHB|2} an additional benefit based on your current aspect:

entries.name: Sowing
entries: Targets gain the effects of the {@spell Regenerate} spell for 1 minute, or until you lose {@status concentration}.

entries.name: Growing
entries: Targets gain advantage on saving throws and ability checks for up to 1 hour, or until you lose {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell).

entries.name: Reaping
entries: Targets gain resistance to necrotic, psychic, and poison damage for 1 hour.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest unless you expend a spell slot of 7th level or higher (no action required) to restore your use of it.

entries.name: Fabled Heirloom
entries: Each Fabled Heirloom is a magic item that grows in strength as its attuned owner gains power. The rarity of each heirloom increases as the character grows in level, as shown on the Heirloom Rarity table. An heirloom's description details the properties it always has, as well as the properties it gains as it increases in rarity. The heirloom has all the properties of its rarity and lower.

entries.name: Lingering Curses
entries: Ending your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to one of these items removes its curse, but the power of a Cursed Curio doesn't release its hold on the user easily. If you attune to it again within 28 days, the progression of its curse returns to where it was before you ended your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}.

itemGroup.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman
entries: This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor's edge and lined with dark fire. It's handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes.
You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe's rarity.
items: Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks
entries: An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol' Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells; you gain a bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks.
items: Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Bell of the Dusk Mother
entries: This heavy iron handbell is elaborately decorated with filigree. Its handle is a large ring, and its clapper hangs from a chain within. Its only sound is ever-mournful tolling.
While holding the bell, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by its rarity.
items: Bell of the Dusk Mother (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Bell of the Dusk Mother (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Bell of the Dusk Mother (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner
entries: This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner's weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

The blunderbuss functions as a {@item Musket|XPHB} that ignores {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading}, and it can make its own ammunition that deals Necrotic damage on a hit. You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it determined by the blunderbuss's rarity. While holding the blunderbuss, you can use the blunderbuss as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells.
items: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald
entries: This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.
While holding the cane, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the cane's rarity.
items: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven
entries: The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.
While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a bonus determined by the cauldron's rarity to all saving throws.
items: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Crown of the Barrow King
entries: This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.
While you wear the crown, you gain a bonus determined by the crown's rarity to spell attack rolls and to your spell save DC for Necromancy spells and spells that deal Necrotic damage.
items: Crown of the Barrow King (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Crown of the Barrow King (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch
entries: A fearsome weapon imbued with jinxcraft magic, this cutlass was once wielded by the notorious pirate captain, Briggsy "The Kutlass" Kratch. Its tarnished blade glimmers with a faint, otherworldly light. A skull and crossbones adorn the leather-wrapped hilt, and arcane symbols etched into the blade pulse with hidden power.
You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with the cutlass determined by its rarity.
items: Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Eye of the White Worm
entries: This fist-sized eyeball is cold and clammy to the touch. It is milky-white with purple veins, and its pupil constantly searches for something.
While holding the eye, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the eye's rarity.
items: Eye of the White Worm (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Eye of the White Worm (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Eye of the White Worm (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth
entries: This cloak was made from the hide of a reptilian magma Fiend, incomparable in its destructive power. Flame now shies away from it, for one who has mastered such a titanic creature can master its element.
While wearing this cloak, you gain a bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} and Constitution saving throws determined by the cloak's rarity.
items: Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Hook of the Tall Man
entries: This hook is made from a single huge claw attached to a large bleached fingerbone mounted on a haft of ash. The tip of the claw gives off an eerie glow. The finger and claw were cut from the hand of the Tall Man.
You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the hook's rarity.
items: Hook of the Tall Man (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Hook of the Tall Man (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Hook of the Tall Man (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight
entries: Made of bleached and mutated bone, this idol in the shape of a stag contains the sinister knowledge of the Beast of Blight. It pulses with the power of rot and decay.
While holding the idol, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the idol's rarity.
items: Idol of the Beast of Blight (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Idol of the Beast of Blight (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Idol of the Beast of Blight (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Lantern of the Chained Reaper
entries: This ornate Hooded Lantern was once a weapon in the hands of the Chained Reaper, filled with ghastly balefire. Able to pierce the veil, the lantern reveals a glimpse at things hidden from mortal eyes.
While you hold the lantern and it is lit, you gain a bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks determined by the lantern's rarity.
items: Lantern of the Chained Reaper (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Lantern of the Chained Reaper (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Lantern of the Chained Reaper (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools
entries: This wooden fool's scepter is painted with vibrant, unsettling colors that depict a grinning face. While no creature is attuned to the marotte, the face looks like the infamous Chuckles, the Lord of Fools.

While holding the marotte, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the marotte's rarity.
items: Marotte of the Lord of Fools (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Marotte of the Lord of Fools (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Marotte of the Lord of Fools (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Mask of Lethica Nightborne
entries: This immaculate porcelain mask is painted with delicate violet filigree and once belonged to Lethica Nightborne—a priestess of a goddess of night and healing known as the Nightmother.
While wearing the mask, you gain a bonus to Wisdom and Charisma saving throws determined by the mask's rarity, and you can use the following properties.
items: Mask of Lethica Nightborne (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Mask of Lethica Nightborne (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Mask of Lethica Nightborne (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Planchette of Adela Druskenvald
entries: A small, heart-shaped silver pointer hangs from a silver necklace. It is inscribed with occult symbols. When placed on an open book or other assortment of letters, the air nearby feels heavy and cold.

While wearing the planchette, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a bonus to Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks determined by the planchette's rarity, and you can use the following properties.
items: Planchette of Adela Druskenvald (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Planchette of Adela Druskenvald (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Planchette of Adela Druskenvald (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Runestone of the Wild Titan
entries: This mighty granite runestone is etched with complex glyphs on much of its angular surface. Though an incredible burden to carry, it thrums with the power of the wild titan. The stone weighs 50 pounds.
While holding the stone, you gain a bonus to Strength and Constitution saving throws determined by the runestone's rarity.
items: Runestone of the Wild Titan (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Runestone of the Wild Titan (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Runestone of the Wild Titan (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Scythe of the Harvest Terror
entries: This menacing scythe with a rusted blade was wielded by the Harvest Terror, a demon of secrets and fear. The scythe appears old and worn, with a handle wrapped in ancient, weathered cloth. The blade is etched with hatch marks, tallying its kills.
You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the scythe, you can use the following properties.
items: Scythe of the Harvest Terror (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Scythe of the Harvest Terror (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Scythe of the Harvest Terror (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Shield of Marius Renathyr
entries: Crafted from polished gold and white enamel and adorned with an intricate design of a rose encircled by thorny vines, this Shield was once owned by Marius Renathyr, a knight-errant destined for a terrible fate.
While holding this Shield, you gain a bonus to AC determined by the Shield's rarity, in addition to the Shield's normal bonus to AC.
items: Shield of Marius Renathyr (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Shield of Marius Renathyr (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Shield of Marius Renathyr (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Shovel of Yorgrim
entries: This shovel features a steel blade and collar at the end of a makeshift walking stick, appearing old and well-used. It was once the shovel of Yorgrim of the Shadestone Clan, who could commune with the spirits of the dead. It occasionally emits a faint whispering sound when handled.
You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the shovel, you can use the following properties.
items: Shovel of Yorgrim (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Shovel of Yorgrim (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Shovel of Yorgrim (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood
entries: This twisted wooden staff is crowned by a trinket-adorned deer's skull. It was fashioned by Farryn before she delved into the dark lore of Gorthos. Soft, fragrant moss and earthy mushrooms grow along the staff's length.
While holding the staff, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the staff's rarity.
items: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Sword of the Crimson Abbot
entries: This powerful, fiendish sword was once wielded by the Crimson Abbot. While it was created as a gift that brought evil and malice to the corrupted former knight, it has lost its connections to the Crimson Rose. However, its evil origins still linger within. The sword is sleek and polished, with a blade that absorbs light. A blood-red ruby on the hilt is fitted within a setting of thorns and roses.
You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by the sword's rarity.
items: Sword of the Crimson Abbot (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Sword of the Crimson Abbot (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Sword of the Crimson Abbot (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan
entries: This tooth is razor sharp and can be wielded as a Dagger. Its "hilt" is wrapped in alligator hide, and the flat of its blade flickers with magenta hex magic in carved glyphs.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the tooth, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells.
items: Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Veil of the Weeping Widow
entries: This mourning veil is imbued with alien power. The Weeping Widow wore the veil to hide her permanently tear-stained face, and rumors circulate that the widow used it to hide the otherworldly corruption writhing within her eyes.
While wearing the veil, you gain a bonus to Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws determined by the veil's rarity.
items: Veil of the Weeping Widow (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Veil of the Weeping Widow (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Veil of the Weeping Widow (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Visage of the Old Ways
entries: This wood-carved mask has a haunted expression and makes the wearer's eyes look like empty shadows. Rabbit ears protrude over the head. While you wear the mask, you hear the whispers of an ancient forest archfey deep within your mind.
While wearing the mask, you gain a bonus to your damage rolls when you deal Fire damage determined by the mask's rarity.
items: Visage of the Old Ways (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Visage of the Old Ways (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Visage of the Old Ways (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

itemGroup.name: Whistle of the Vagrant
entries: This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.
While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a bonus determined by the whistle's rarity to all saving throws.
items: Whistle of the Vagrant (Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Whistle of the Vagrant (Very Rare)|CrookedMoon24
Whistle of the Vagrant (Legendary)|CrookedMoon24

item.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Rare)
entries: This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor's edge and lined with dark fire. It's handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe's rarity. You can also use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiery Smite (Rare+)
entries: This axe deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage on a hit. If the target is a creature that damaged you since the end of your last turn, the extra damage becomes {@dice 1d10}.

item.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Very Rare)
entries: This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor's edge and lined with dark fire. It's handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe's rarity. You can also use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiery Smite (Rare+)
entries: This axe deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage on a hit. If the target is a creature that damaged you since the end of your last turn, the extra damage becomes {@dice 1d10}.

entries.name: Mark of Guilt (Very Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the axe, you can mark it for punishment (no action required). You know the direction and distance to the creature. If it leaves this plane of existence, you know the destination plane and the mark ends. The mark otherwise ends when this property is used again, or when the target dies.

entries.name: Sense Guilt (Very Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to hold the blade of the axe to a creature's neck (if it has one), and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the axe's bonus) or you learn something the creature feels guilty about. Once this property is used, the target is immune to it for 24 hours.

item.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Legendary)
entries: This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor's edge and lined with dark fire. It's handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe's rarity. You can also use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiery Smite (Rare+)
entries: This axe deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage on a hit. If the target is a creature that damaged you since the end of your last turn, the extra damage becomes {@dice 1d10}.

entries.name: Mark of Guilt (Very Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the axe, you can mark it for punishment (no action required). You know the direction and distance to the creature. If it leaves this plane of existence, you know the destination plane and the mark ends. The mark otherwise ends when this property is used again, or when the target dies.

entries.name: Sense Guilt (Very Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to hold the blade of the axe to a creature's neck (if it has one), and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the axe's bonus) or you learn something the creature feels guilty about. Once this property is used, the target is immune to it for 24 hours.

entries.name: Dark Binding (Legendary)
entries: Once during your turn when you hit a creature with the axe, you can immediately take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to force the target to succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} and {@condition Prone|XPHB} conditions until the start of your next turn. If its body shape allows it, the target kneels and presents its neck.

entries.name: Executioner's Blade (Legendary)
entries: When you attack a creature with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition using the axe, you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. On a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, the axe deals an extra {@damage 3d6} Fire damage, and if the creature is left with 20 or fewer {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or die.

item.name: Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Rare)
entries: An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol' Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells; you gain a +1 bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks; and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiendish Lure (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, choose one Fiend or Humanoid that you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the banjo's bonus) or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition (ignoring a demon's {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}) for 1 minute. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends if you or your allies deal damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Scarecrow's Dance (Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to strum the banjo and dance wildly to take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action. The music is audible within 120 feet.

item.name: Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Very Rare)
entries: An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol' Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells; you gain a +2 bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks; and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiendish Lure (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, choose one Fiend or Humanoid that you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the banjo's bonus) or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition (ignoring a demon's {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}) for 1 minute. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends if you or your allies deal damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Scarecrow's Dance (Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to strum the banjo and dance wildly to take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action. The music is audible within 120 feet.

entries.name: Join in the Dance (Very Rare+)
entries: When you use Scarecrow's Dance, one creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

item.name: Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Legendary)
entries: An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol' Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells; you gain a +3 bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks; and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiendish Lure (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, choose one Fiend or Humanoid that you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the banjo's bonus) or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition (ignoring a demon's {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}) for 1 minute. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends if you or your allies deal damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to strum the banjo and dance wildly to take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action. The music is audible within 120 feet.

entries.name: Join in the Dance (Very Rare+)
entries: When you use Scarecrow's Dance, one creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

entries.name: Birdcage (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, you can force a creature you have {@condition Charmed|XPHB} to make a DC 19 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature disappears, drawn into the banjo. The banjo can contain one creature at a time in this way for up to 24 hours. On a success, the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends on the creature.

item.name: Bell of the Dusk Mother (Rare)
entries: This heavy iron handbell is elaborately decorated with filigree. Its handle is a large ring, and its clapper hangs from a chain within. Its only sound is ever-mournful tolling.

While holding the bell, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by its rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Dolorous Tolling (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ring the bell, producing an ominous tolling. Creatures of your choice in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the bell's bonus). On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d10} Psychic damage, and for 1 minute, when it makes an attack roll or saving throw, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the total. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Bell of the Dusk Mother (Very Rare)
entries: This heavy iron handbell is elaborately decorated with filigree. Its handle is a large ring, and its clapper hangs from a chain within. Its only sound is ever-mournful tolling.

While holding the bell, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by its rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Dolorous Tolling (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ring the bell, producing an ominous tolling. Creatures of your choice in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the bell's bonus). On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d10} Psychic damage, and for 1 minute, when it makes an attack roll or saving throw, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the total. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Call of the Bell (Very Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to create a doll (use the {@creature Animated Armor|XMM} stat block) from a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of wood, clay, or stone within 10 feet. The doll obeys your commands and acts immediately after your turn on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}. It reverts to the materials used to create it after 10 minutes or when it dies. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Bell of the Dusk Mother (Legendary)
entries: This heavy iron handbell is elaborately decorated with filigree. Its handle is a large ring, and its clapper hangs from a chain within. Its only sound is ever-mournful tolling.

While holding the bell, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by its rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ring the bell, producing an ominous tolling. Creatures of your choice in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the bell's bonus). On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d10} Psychic damage, and for 1 minute, when it makes an attack roll or saving throw, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the total. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to create a doll (use the {@creature Animated Armor|XMM} stat block) from a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of wood, clay, or stone within 10 feet. The doll obeys your commands and acts immediately after your turn on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}. It reverts to the materials used to create it after 10 minutes or when it dies. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Death Knell (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ring the bell, creating a loud clang. Each {@status Bloodied|XPHB} creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d10} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Rare)
entries: This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner's weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

The blunderbuss functions as a {@item Musket|XPHB} that ignores {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading}, and it can make its own ammunition that deals Necrotic damage on a hit. You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it determined by the blunderbuss's rarity. While holding the blunderbuss, you can use the blunderbuss as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Jinxshot (Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a blast from the blunderbuss that forces each creature within a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss's bonus), taking {@damage 2d4} Necrotic damage (Rare) or {@damage 3d6} Necrotic damage (Very Rare+) on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Very Rare)
entries: This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner's weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

The blunderbuss functions as a {@item Musket|XPHB} that ignores {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading}, and it can make its own ammunition that deals Necrotic damage on a hit. You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it determined by the blunderbuss's rarity. While holding the blunderbuss, you can use the blunderbuss as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Sinner's Jinx (Very Rare+)
entries: Once during your turn when you damage a creature with the blunderbuss, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss's bonus) or be cursed for 1 minute. When it makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} while cursed, it subtracts {@dice 1d4} from the total. The curse ends if this property is used on another creature.

item.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Legendary)
entries: This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner's weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

While holding the blunderbuss, you can use the blunderbuss as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Jinxshot (Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a blast from the blunderbuss that forces each creature within a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss's bonus), taking {@damage 2d4} Necrotic damage (Rare) or {@damage 3d6} Necrotic damage (Very Rare+) on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Sinner's Jinx (Very Rare+)
entries: Once during your turn when you damage a creature with the blunderbuss, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss's bonus) or be cursed for 1 minute. When it makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} while cursed, it subtracts {@dice 1d4} from the total. The curse ends if this property is used on another creature.

entries.name: Luck Taker (Legendary)
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that is cursed by this weapon makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and rolls a 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to mimic their luck. The next time you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} within 1 minute, change the number you roll on the {@dice d20} to the triggering number.

item.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Rare)
entries: This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

While holding the cane, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the cane's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Eldritch Glutton (Rare+)
entries: When you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that targets only you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to consume the spell and store its energy in the cane. The spell has no effect on you. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to absorb the stored energy to either regain an expended spell slot that is at least one level lower than the triggering spell or gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times the spell's level. If you absorb a new spell while the cane holds spell energy, the previous energy is lost. Once the cane absorbs a spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Very Rare)
entries: This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

While holding the cane, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the cane's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Eldritch Glutton (Rare+)
entries: When you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that targets only you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to consume the spell and store its energy in the cane. The spell has no effect on you. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to absorb the stored energy to either regain an expended spell slot that is at least one level lower than the triggering spell or gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times the spell's level. If you absorb a new spell while the cane holds spell energy, the previous energy is lost. Once the cane absorbs a spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Allure of Sin (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the cane's bonus) from the cane. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by the spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Legendary)
entries: This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

While holding the cane, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the cane's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Eldritch Glutton (Rare+)

The spell has no effect on you. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to absorb the stored energy to either regain an expended spell slot that is at least one level lower than the triggering spell or gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times the spell's level. If you absorb a new spell while the cane holds spell energy, the previous energy is lost. Once the cane absorbs a spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Allure of Sin (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the cane's bonus) from the cane. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by the spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sin-Binder's Call (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon three Hell Hounds, one Incubus, or one Succubus. They appear in unoccupied spaces you can see within 30 feet of you, obey your commands, and take their turns immediately after yours on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. After 10 minutes, they no longer obey you, but if you treated them well, they are {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} or {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} toward you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Rare)
entries: The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.

While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus determined by the cauldron's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Size Change (Rare+)
entries: You can perform a 1-minute ritual to change the cauldron's size from Tiny to Medium, or from Medium to Tiny. It weighs 1 lb. when Tiny and 80 lb. when Medium. As a Medium object, its feet can move. It has a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 20 feet and moves when you command it during your turn (no action required).

entries.name: Cookpot (Rare+)
entries: As part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can use the Medium cauldron to prepare food for up to ten creatures. At the end of the rest, each creature that eats gains {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Vermincall (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spill liquid from the cauldron to cast {@spell Conjure Animals|XPHB} with it. The conjured spirits take the form of grotesque insects or rats. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Very Rare)
entries: The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.

While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus determined by the cauldron's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Size Change (Rare+)
entries: You can perform a 1-minute ritual to change the cauldron's size from Tiny to Medium, or from Medium to Tiny. It weighs 1 lb. when Tiny and 80 lb. when Medium. As a Medium object, its feet can move. It has a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 20 feet and moves when you command it during your turn (no action required).

entries.name: Cookpot (Rare+)
entries: As part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can use the Medium cauldron to prepare food for up to ten creatures. At the end of the rest, each creature that eats gains {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Vermincall (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spill liquid from the cauldron to cast {@spell Conjure Animals|XPHB} with it. The conjured spirits take the form of grotesque insects or rats. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Fortifying Gorge (Very Rare+)
entries: When you use the Cookpot property, one creature of your choice who eats gains a +2 bonus to AC until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. During this time, the creature's skin is hardened and monstrous.

item.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Legendary)
entries: The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.

While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +3 bonus determined by the cauldron's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Vermincall (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spill liquid from the cauldron to cast {@spell Conjure Animals|XPHB} with it. The conjured spirits take the form of grotesque insects or rats. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Fortifying Gorge (Very Rare+)
entries: When you use the Cookpot property, one creature of your choice who eats gains a +2 bonus to AC until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. During this time, the creature's skin is hardened and monstrous.

entries.name: Coven Abomination (Legendary)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can drink from the cauldron or administer a draught from it to a creature within 5 feet. For 1 hour, the drinker of the thick, sickly-sweet liquid becomes Large if it is currently smaller than that, its reach increases by 5 feet, and its melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d8} damage. When the effect ends, the creature has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition for 1 minute from the agony of its bones shrinking slower than its flesh.

item.name: Crown of the Barrow King (Rare)
entries: This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.

While you wear the crown, you gain a +1 bonus determined by the crown's rarity to spell attack rolls and to your spell save DC for Necromancy spells and spells that deal Necrotic damage, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Demand of the Dead (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} from the crown.

entries.name: Grave Grasp (Rare+)
entries: You know the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} cantrip. Your spell attack bonus with it is +9 (Rare), +10 (Very Rare), or +11 (Legendary).

entries.name: Necromancer's Call (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} from the crown. It can be used to cast this spell three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Crown of the Barrow King (Very Rare)
entries: This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.

While you wear the crown, you gain a +2 bonus determined by the crown's rarity to spell attack rolls and to your spell save DC for Necromancy spells and spells that deal Necrotic damage, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Demand of the Dead (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} from the crown.

entries.name: Grave Grasp (Rare+)
entries: You know the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} cantrip. Your spell attack bonus with it is +9 (Rare), +10 (Very Rare), or +11 (Legendary).

entries.name: Necromancer's Call (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} from the crown. It can be used to cast this spell three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Master of Undeath (Very Rare+)
entries: Undead that you create or summon have twice as many {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as normal and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws.

entries.name: Soul Transfer (Very Rare+)
entries: When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fail a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}, you can transfer your soul into an Undead that you created and that is within 1 mile of you (no action required). Your previous body dies instantly. Your new body has none of your possessions except the crown. You use your game statistics, except the target Undead's current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} replace your current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Crown of the Barrow King (Legendary)
entries: This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.

You use your game statistics, except the target Undead's current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} replace your current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Compel Undead (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can choose an Undead within 30 feet of you. It must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. It obeys your commands while {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, and the condition ends early when the creature is {@status Bloodied|XPHB}.

item.name: Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch (Rare)
entries: A fearsome weapon imbued with jinxcraft magic, this cutlass was once wielded by the notorious pirate captain, Briggsy "The Kutlass" Kratch. Its tarnished blade glimmers with a faint, otherworldly light. A skull and crossbones adorn the leather-wrapped hilt, and arcane symbols etched into the blade pulse with hidden power.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with the cutlass determined by its rarity. While holding the cutlass, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Raise the Stakes (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature within 5 feet of you and mark it until the start of your next turn. Count the number of times you hit the target and the number of times it hits you while the mark lasts. If you hit the target more times, it takes {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. If it hits you more times, you take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. If your hits are tied, you both take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sea Legs (Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement until the end of that turn.

item.name: Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch (Very Rare)
entries: A fearsome weapon imbued with jinxcraft magic, this cutlass was once wielded by the notorious pirate captain, Briggsy "The Kutlass" Kratch. Its tarnished blade glimmers with a faint, otherworldly light. A skull and crossbones adorn the leather-wrapped hilt, and arcane symbols etched into the blade pulse with hidden power.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with the cutlass determined by its rarity. While holding the cutlass, you can use the following properties.

If it hits you more times, you take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. If your hits are tied, you both take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sea Legs (Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement until the end of that turn.

entries.name: Double Down (Very Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can make one additional attack against a target marked by the Raise the Stakes property.

entries.name: Jinxcraft Panache (Very Rare+)
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to increase your AC against that attack by twice the cutlass's bonus to attack and damage rolls if the creature already dealt damage to you on this turn.

entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to increase your AC against that attack by twice the cutlass's bonus to attack and damage rolls if the creature already dealt damage to you on this turn.

entries.name: Hex Ward (Legendary)
entries: You can't be targeted with Divination spells or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and a creature that curses you takes Psychic damage equal to your level.

item.name: Eye of the White Worm (Rare)
entries: This fist-sized eyeball is cold and clammy to the touch. It is milky-white with purple veins, and its pupil constantly searches for something.

While holding the eye, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the eye's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Thought Scour (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the eye's bonus) from the eye. When you probe deeper into a creature's mind, it takes {@damage 3d8} Psychic damage unless it is a willing target. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Eye of the White Worm (Very Rare)
entries: This fist-sized eyeball is cold and clammy to the touch. It is milky-white with purple veins, and its pupil constantly searches for something.

While holding the eye, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the eye's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Mnemonic Siphon (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Modify Memory|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the eye's bonus) from the eye. When you do, you gain a version of the affected memory as if you experienced it yourself, though you still know the memory isn't yours. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Violation of the Real (Very Rare+)
entries: When you cast a Conjuration spell using a spell slot that deals damage, or that summons a creature that can deal damage, the spell or creature deals an extra {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage to one target the first time it deals damage during a turn.

entries: When you cast a Conjuration spell using a spell slot that deals damage, or that summons a creature that can deal damage, the spell or creature deals an extra {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage to one target the first time it deals damage during a turn.

entries.name: Enduring Violation (Legendary)
entries: When you cast a Conjuration spell with a duration of 1 hour or more, you can extend the duration to 24 hours, and the spell no longer requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth (Rare)
entries: This cloak was made from the hide of a reptilian magma Fiend, incomparable in its destructive power. Flame now shies away from it, for one who has mastered such a titanic creature can master its element.
While wearing this cloak, you gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} and Constitution saving throws determined by the cloak's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Deep-Dweller (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage and a {@variantrule Burrow Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. Once during your turn when you emerge from burrowing, each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the hide's bonus), taking {@damage 2d8} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Infernal Roar (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Fear|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the hide's bonus) from the cloak. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} Fire damage and {@damage 4d6} Necrotic damage, and it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half damage only. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Pernicious Fire Immunity (Legendary)
entries: Fire actively avoids you. You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Fire damage. When you are the target of an attack that deals Fire damage, the attack randomly targets another creature within the attack's range, which can include the attacker. When you make a saving throw against an effect that deals Fire damage, you must choose one other creature that is also making the saving throw against that effect. It has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the save.

item.name: Hook of the Tall Man (Rare)
entries: This hook is made from a single huge claw attached to a large bleached fingerbone mounted on a haft of ash. The tip of the claw gives off an eerie glow. The finger and claw were cut from the hand of the Tall Man.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the hook's rarity. While holding the hook, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Snare (Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the hook, you can activate the {@itemMastery Topple|XPHB} mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you're using with it.

entries.name: Fey Haunt's Stride (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} from the hook, and when you do so, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on your next Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check made before the end of your next turn. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

item.name: Hook of the Tall Man (Very Rare)
entries: This hook is made from a single huge claw attached to a large bleached fingerbone mounted on a haft of ash. The tip of the claw gives off an eerie glow. The finger and claw were cut from the hand of the Tall Man.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the hook's rarity. While holding the hook, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Snare (Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the hook, you can activate the {@itemMastery Topple|XPHB} mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you're using with it.

entries.name: Fey Haunt's Stride (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} from the hook, and when you do so, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on your next Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check made before the end of your next turn. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

entries.name: Strike from Shadows (Very Rare+)
entries: When you start your turn with the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack you make on your turn, even if the condition ends before you make the attack. If that attack hits, it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} Piercing damage.

item.name: Hook of the Tall Man (Legendary)
entries: This hook is made from a single huge claw attached to a large bleached fingerbone mounted on a haft of ash. The tip of the claw gives off an eerie glow. The finger and claw were cut from the hand of the Tall Man.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the hook's rarity. While holding the hook, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Snare (Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the hook, you can activate the {@itemMastery Topple|XPHB} mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you're using with it.

entries.name: Fey Haunt's Stride (Rare+)
