This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

entries.name: Strike from Shadows (Very Rare+)
entries: When you start your turn with the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack you make on your turn, even if the condition ends before you make the attack. If that attack hits, it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} Piercing damage.

entries.name: Hunter's Hook (Legendary)
entries: When you hit with an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} made with the hook, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage, and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the end of the turn.

entries.name: Terrifying Stride (Legendary)
entries: Immediately after you use the Fey Haunt's Stride property, you can choose a creature within 20 feet of you. It must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. While {@condition Frightened|XPHB} in this way, the creature can't take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action.

item.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight (Rare)
entries: Made of bleached and mutated bone, this idol in the shape of a stag contains the sinister knowledge of the Beast of Blight. It pulses with the power of rot and decay.

While holding the idol, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the idol's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Rotting Touch (Rare+)
entries: You can use your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}, and on a hit, your strike deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage (Rare), {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage (Very Rare), or {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage (Legendary).

entries.name: Touch of Oblivion (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can touch a creature that has been dead for less than 1 hour. It rots away to bleached bone and can't be used for this property again. The next time you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} instead.

item.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight (Very Rare)
entries: Made of bleached and mutated bone, this idol in the shape of a stag contains the sinister knowledge of the Beast of Blight. It pulses with the power of rot and decay.

While holding the idol, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the idol's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Rotting Touch (Rare+)
entries: You can use your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}, and on a hit, your strike deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage (Rare), {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage (Very Rare), or {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage (Legendary).

entries.name: Touch of Oblivion (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can touch a creature that has been dead for less than 1 hour. It rots away to bleached bone and can't be used for this property again. The next time you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} instead.

entries.name: Hallucinatory Spores (Very Rare+)
entries: When you cast a spell using a spell slot or from the idol, you can choose one creature that you can see within 10 feet of you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the idol's bonus) or take {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage and have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Rot in the Flesh (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Barkskin|XPHB} from the idol targeting only yourself. For the duration, a creature that hits you with a melee attack roll takes {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage. Once the spell is cast from the idol, it can't be cast from it again until the next dusk.

item.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight (Legendary)
entries: Made of bleached and mutated bone, this idol in the shape of a stag contains the sinister knowledge of the Beast of Blight. It pulses with the power of rot and decay.

While holding the idol, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the idol's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

The next time you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} instead.

entries: When you cast a spell using a spell slot or from the idol, you can choose one creature that you can see within 10 feet of you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the idol's bonus) or take {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage and have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Rot in the Flesh (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Barkskin|XPHB} from the idol targeting only yourself. For the duration, a creature that hits you with a melee attack roll takes {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage. Once the spell is cast from the idol, it can't be cast from it again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Hollow with Rot (Legendary)
entries: When you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from a spell, you also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the spell's level.

item.name: Lantern of the Chained Reaper (Rare)
entries: This ornate Hooded Lantern was once a weapon in the hands of the Chained Reaper, filled with ghastly balefire. Able to pierce the veil, the lantern reveals a glimpse at things hidden from mortal eyes.

While you hold the lantern and it is lit, you gain a +1 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks determined by the lantern's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Ghostly Flame (Rare+)
entries: The lantern doesn't require fuel, and it sheds blue-green light. It casts {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet. You can snuff or ignite its light as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while you are within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Revealing Flame (Rare+)
entries: Creatures in the Border Ethereal within the area of the lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} are visible to creatures on the Material Plane. When a creature within the lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} is possessed or affected by the {@spell Magic Jar|XPHB} spell, the creature in control appears overlaid on the body in a spectral form.

item.name: Lantern of the Chained Reaper (Very Rare)
entries: This ornate Hooded Lantern was once a weapon in the hands of the Chained Reaper, filled with ghastly balefire. Able to pierce the veil, the lantern reveals a glimpse at things hidden from mortal eyes.

While you hold the lantern and it is lit, you gain a +2 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks determined by the lantern's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Ghostly Flame (Rare+)
entries: The lantern doesn't require fuel, and it sheds blue-green light. It casts {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet. You can snuff or ignite its light as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while you are within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Revealing Flame (Rare+)
entries: Creatures in the Border Ethereal within the area of the lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} are visible to creatures on the Material Plane. When a creature within the lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} is possessed or affected by the {@spell Magic Jar|XPHB} spell, the creature in control appears overlaid on the body in a spectral form.

entries.name: Mystic Sight (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} from the lantern. The spell ends early if you extinguish the light or aren't holding the lantern.

entries.name: Summon Spirit (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon a {@creature Ghost|XMM} that appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. The ghost obeys your commands, and it takes its turn immediately after you on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. The ghost vanishes after 1 minute, or when it dies. You can't use the lantern's properties, except for Ghostly Flame, during this time.

item.name: Lantern of the Chained Reaper (Legendary)
entries: This ornate Hooded Lantern was once a weapon in the hands of the Chained Reaper, filled with ghastly balefire. Able to pierce the veil, the lantern reveals a glimpse at things hidden from mortal eyes.

While you hold the lantern and it is lit, you gain a +3 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks determined by the lantern's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

When a creature within the lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} is possessed or affected by the {@spell Magic Jar|XPHB} spell, the creature in control appears overlaid on the body in a spectral form.

entries.name: Mystic Sight (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} from the lantern. The spell ends early if you extinguish the light or aren't holding the lantern.

entries.name: Summon Spirit (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon a {@creature Ghost|XMM} that appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. The ghost obeys your commands, and it takes its turn immediately after you on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. The ghost vanishes after 1 minute, or when it dies. You can't use the lantern's properties, except for Ghostly Flame, during this time.

entries.name: Balefire (Legendary)
entries: You can cast {@spell Scorching Ray|XPHB} (level 5 version, +11 to hit) from the lantern. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Warding Light (Legendary)
entries: The lantern's area of {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} offers the protection of a {@spell Magic Circle|XPHB} spell. This protection can't operate in the reverse direction, and it ends if you aren't holding the lantern or if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools (Rare)
entries: This wooden fool's scepter is painted with vibrant, unsettling colors that depict a grinning face. While no creature is attuned to the marotte, the face looks like the infamous Chuckles, the Lord of Fools.

While holding the marotte, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the marotte's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Coulrophobia (Rare+)
entries: When you succeed on a saving throw to avoid the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the creature that created the effect to make the same saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Fortune's Fool (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} (save DC = 16 + the marotte's bonus) from the marotte. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk. You regain use of the spell early if you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.

item.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools (Very Rare)
entries: This wooden fool's scepter is painted with vibrant, unsettling colors that depict a grinning face. While no creature is attuned to the marotte, the face looks like the infamous Chuckles, the Lord of Fools.

While holding the marotte, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the marotte's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Coulrophobia (Rare+)
entries: When you succeed on a saving throw to avoid the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the creature that created the effect to make the same saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Fortune's Fool (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} (save DC = 16 + the marotte's bonus) from the marotte. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk. You regain use of the spell early if you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fool's Motley (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell False Life|XPHB} from the marotte. Any clothing or armor you wear looks like a fool's motley for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Slapstick (Very Rare+)
entries: When a creature is affected by a {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} spell you cast, you can choose another creature. When that creature deals damage to the target of the spell, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} rather than {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its saving throw to end the spell.

item.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools (Legendary)
entries: This wooden fool's scepter is painted with vibrant, unsettling colors that depict a grinning face. While no creature is attuned to the marotte, the face looks like the infamous Chuckles, the Lord of Fools.

entries: You can cast {@spell False Life|XPHB} from the marotte. Any clothing or armor you wear looks like a fool's motley for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Slapstick (Very Rare+)
entries: When a creature is affected by a {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} spell you cast, you can choose another creature. When that creature deals damage to the target of the spell, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} rather than {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its saving throw to end the spell.

entries.name: Lord of Fools (Legendary)
entries: You can cast {@spell Mass Suggestion|XPHB} (save DC 19) from the marotte. The effect ends on a creature if it is behind {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} or more than 120 feet from you. A creature affected by your {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} automatically fails its saving throw against this Mass Suggestion. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Mask of Lethica Nightborne (Rare)
entries: This immaculate porcelain mask is painted with delicate violet filigree and once belonged to Lethica Nightborne—a priestess of a goddess of night and healing known as the Nightmother.
While wearing the mask, you gain a +1 bonus to Wisdom and Charisma saving throws determined by the mask's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Gift of the Night Goddess (Rare+)
entries: You can see normally in magical and nonmagical {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} and {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}.

entries.name: Soothing Darkness (Rare+)
entries: Creatures of your choice in the area of a {@spell Darkness|XPHB} spell that you cast have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

entries.name: Whispers of Night (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Darkness|XPHB} from the mask. This property can be used twice (Very Rare+: four times), regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Mask of Lethica Nightborne (Very Rare)
entries: This immaculate porcelain mask is painted with delicate violet filigree and once belonged to Lethica Nightborne—a priestess of a goddess of night and healing known as the Nightmother.
While wearing the mask, you gain a +2 bonus to Wisdom and Charisma saving throws determined by the mask's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries: You can see normally in magical and nonmagical {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} and {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}.

entries: Creatures of your choice in the area of a {@spell Darkness|XPHB} spell that you cast have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

entries.name: Whispers of Night (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Darkness|XPHB} from the mask. This property can be used twice (Very Rare+: four times), regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Balm of Midnight (Very Rare+)
entries: At the start of your turn, a {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature of your choice within 60 feet of you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the condition ends, and if the creature is in an area of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, it gains {@dice 2d10} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

item.name: Mask of Lethica Nightborne (Legendary)
entries: This immaculate porcelain mask is painted with delicate violet filigree and once belonged to Lethica Nightborne—a priestess of a goddess of night and healing known as the Nightmother.
While wearing the mask, you gain a +3 bonus to Wisdom and Charisma saving throws determined by the mask's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries: You can cast {@spell Darkness|XPHB} from the mask. This property can be used twice (Very Rare+: four times), regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Balm of Midnight (Very Rare+)
entries: At the start of your turn, a {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature of your choice within 60 feet of you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the condition ends, and if the creature is in an area of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, it gains {@dice 2d10} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Offering of Burdens (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch a willing creature with {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels and transfer any number of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels to yourself, then remove up to two {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels from yourself and regain one expended spell slot of level 5 or lower. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Surcease of Sorrows (Legendary)
entries: You can cast {@spell Modify Memory|XPHB} from the mask (save DC 19). If the target voluntarily fails the saving throw, you can choose a memory that happened at any time in its lifespan. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Planchette of Adela Druskenvald (Rare)
entries: A small, heart-shaped silver pointer hangs from a silver necklace. It is inscribed with occult symbols. When placed on an open book or other assortment of letters, the air nearby feels heavy and cold.

While wearing the planchette, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks determined by the planchette's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Sense the Unseen (Rare+)
entries: The planchette has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dusk. You can expend charges to cast the following spells from it: {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} (1 charge), {@spell Locate Object|XPHB} (2 charges), {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} (2 charges).

entries.name: Starlight Ward (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant damage. When you take Radiant damage, for the next minute, the star-sigils on the planchette shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 10 feet.

item.name: Planchette of Adela Druskenvald (Very Rare)
entries: A small, heart-shaped silver pointer hangs from a silver necklace. It is inscribed with occult symbols. When placed on an open book or other assortment of letters, the air nearby feels heavy and cold.

While wearing the planchette, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks determined by the planchette's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Sense the Unseen (Rare+)
entries: The planchette has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dusk. You can expend charges to cast the following spells from it: {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} (1 charge), {@spell Locate Object|XPHB} (2 charges), {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} (2 charges).

entries.name: Starlight Ward (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant damage. When you take Radiant damage, for the next minute, the star-sigils on the planchette shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 10 feet.

entries.name: Vision Beyond (Very Rare+)
entries: The planchette now has 9 charges and regains {@dice 1d8 + 1} expended charges daily at dusk. You can also cast {@spell Find Traps|XPHB} (2 charges) and {@spell Sending|XPHB} (3 charges) from it.

entries.name: Spirit Ward (Very Rare+)
entries: When you fail a saving throw against the {@spell Magic Jar|XPHB} spell or possession (such as by a {@creature ghost|XMM}), you can expend 3 charges to succeed instead.

item.name: Planchette of Adela Druskenvald (Legendary)
entries: A small, heart-shaped silver pointer hangs from a silver necklace. It is inscribed with occult symbols. When placed on an open book or other assortment of letters, the air nearby feels heavy and cold.

While wearing the planchette, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +3 bonus to Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks determined by the planchette's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Sense the Unseen (Rare+)
entries: The planchette has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dusk. You can expend charges to cast the following spells from it: {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} (1 charge), {@spell Locate Object|XPHB} (2 charges), {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB} (2 charges).

entries.name: Starlight Ward (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Radiant damage. When you take Radiant damage, for the next minute, the star-sigils on the planchette shed {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 10 feet.

entries.name: Vision Beyond (Very Rare+)
entries: The planchette now has 9 charges and regains {@dice 1d8 + 1} expended charges daily at dusk. You can also cast {@spell Find Traps|XPHB} (2 charges) and {@spell Sending|XPHB} (3 charges) from it.

entries.name: Spirit Ward (Very Rare+)
entries: When you fail a saving throw against the {@spell Magic Jar|XPHB} spell or possession (such as by a {@creature ghost|XMM}), you can expend 3 charges to succeed instead.

entries.name: Third Eye Opened (Legendary)
entries: The planchette now has 13 charges and regains {@dice 1d12 + 1} expended charges daily at dusk. You can also cast {@spell Divination|XPHB} (4 charges), {@spell Contact Other Plane|XPHB} (5 charges), and {@spell Etherealness|XPHB} (7 charges) from it.

item.name: Runestone of the Wild Titan (Rare)
entries: This mighty granite runestone is etched with complex glyphs on much of its angular surface. Though an incredible burden to carry, it thrums with the power of the wild titan. The stone weighs 50 pounds.
While holding the stone, you gain a +1 bonus to Strength and Constitution saving throws determined by the runestone's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Crushing Weight (Rare+)
entries: When you are within 5 feet of a creature with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to set the stone on the creature to give it the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. The creature can take an action to make a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone's bonus), pushing the stone free and ending the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition on a success.

item.name: Runestone of the Wild Titan (Very Rare)
entries: This mighty granite runestone is etched with complex glyphs on much of its angular surface. Though an incredible burden to carry, it thrums with the power of the wild titan. The stone weighs 50 pounds.
While holding the stone, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength and Constitution saving throws determined by the runestone's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Crushing Weight (Rare+)
entries: When you are within 5 feet of a creature with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to set the stone on the creature to give it the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. The creature can take an action to make a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone's bonus), pushing the stone free and ending the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition on a success.

entries.name: Boulder Throw (Very Rare+)
entries: You can throw the stone as a Simple Ranged weapon using Strength for the attack and damage rolls. The stone has the Heavy and Thrown properties. It has a normal range equal to twice your Strength score and a long range equal to five times your Strength score. On a hit, it deals {@damage 2d10} Bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone's bonus) or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Recall (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can call the stone back to you, provided it is within 1 mile. If you have an empty hand, it appears in your hand; otherwise, it appears at your feet in your space.

item.name: Runestone of the Wild Titan (Legendary)
entries: This mighty granite runestone is etched with complex glyphs on much of its angular surface. Though an incredible burden to carry, it thrums with the power of the wild titan. The stone weighs 50 pounds.
While holding the stone, you gain a +3 bonus to Strength and Constitution saving throws determined by the runestone's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Crushing Weight (Rare+)
entries: When you are within 5 feet of a creature with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to set the stone on the creature to give it the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. The creature can take an action to make a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone's bonus), pushing the stone free and ending the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition on a success.

entries.name: Boulder Throw (Very Rare+)
entries: You can throw the stone as a Simple Ranged weapon using Strength for the attack and damage rolls. The stone has the Heavy and Thrown properties. It has a normal range equal to twice your Strength score and a long range equal to five times your Strength score. On a hit, it deals {@damage 2d10} Bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone's bonus) or have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Recall (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can call the stone back to you, provided it is within 1 mile. If you have an empty hand, it appears in your hand; otherwise, it appears at your feet in your space.

entries.name: Primal Vitality (Legendary)
entries: While you stand on fertile soil or unworked stone, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength and Constitution saving throws, and you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Strength modifier at the start of each of your turns.

entries.name: Pummeling Boulder (Legendary)
entries: The damage of the Boulder Throw property increases to {@dice 3d10}, and the stone deals double damage to objects and structures.

item.name: Scythe of the Harvest Terror (Rare)
entries: This menacing scythe with a rusted blade was wielded by the Harvest Terror, a demon of secrets and fear. The scythe appears old and worn, with a handle wrapped in ancient, weathered cloth. The blade is etched with hatch marks, tallying its kills.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the scythe, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Feed on Fear (Rare+)
entries: Once during your turn, when you attack with the scythe and hit a creature that has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, it takes an extra {@dice 1d10} (Legendary: {@dice 2d10}) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Sweep of Dread (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Fear|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the scythe's bonus, no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from the scythe. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Scythe of the Harvest Terror (Very Rare)
entries: This menacing scythe with a rusted blade was wielded by the Harvest Terror, a demon of secrets and fear. The scythe appears old and worn, with a handle wrapped in ancient, weathered cloth. The blade is etched with hatch marks, tallying its kills.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the scythe, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Feed on Fear (Rare+)
entries: Once during your turn, when you attack with the scythe and hit a creature that has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, it takes an extra {@dice 1d10} (Legendary: {@dice 2d10}) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Sweep of Dread (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Fear|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the scythe's bonus, no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from the scythe. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Harvest of the Hidden Word (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can force one creature you can see that has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the scythe's bonus). On a failed save, you learn one fact that it deliberately keeps secret. The creature is then immune to this property for 24 hours.

entries.name: Seed of Terror (Very Rare+)
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with the scythe, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to force one creature within 30 feet of the creature you hit to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the Scythe's bonus). On a failed save, the creature gains the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Scythe of the Harvest Terror (Legendary)
entries: This menacing scythe with a rusted blade was wielded by the Harvest Terror, a demon of secrets and fear. The scythe appears old and worn, with a handle wrapped in ancient, weathered cloth. The blade is etched with hatch marks, tallying its kills.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the scythe, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Feed on Fear (Rare+)
entries: Once during your turn, when you attack with the scythe and hit a creature that has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, it takes an extra {@dice 1d10} (Legendary: {@dice 2d10}) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Sweep of Dread (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Fear|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the scythe's bonus, no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from the scythe. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Harvest of the Hidden Word (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can force one creature you can see that has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the scythe's bonus). On a failed save, you learn one fact that it deliberately keeps secret. The creature is then immune to this property for 24 hours.

entries.name: Seed of Terror (Very Rare+)
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with the scythe, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to force one creature within 30 feet of the creature you hit to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the Scythe's bonus). On a failed save, the creature gains the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Lurking Terror (Legendary)
entries: When a creature you can see that has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition ends its turn within 60 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature can see.

item.name: Shield of Marius Renathyr (Rare)
entries: Crafted from polished gold and white enamel and adorned with an intricate design of a rose encircled by thorny vines, this Shield was once owned by Marius Renathyr, a knight-errant destined for a terrible fate.
While holding this Shield, you gain a +1 bonus to AC determined by the Shield's rarity, in addition to the Shield's normal bonus to AC, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Valorous Guard (Rare+)
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add 2 + the Shield's bonus to the creature's AC, potentially causing the attack to miss. When a creature within 5 feet of you fails a Dexterity saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add 2 + the Shield's bonus to the creature's total, potentially causing it to succeed.

item.name: Shield of Marius Renathyr (Very Rare)
entries: Crafted from polished gold and white enamel and adorned with an intricate design of a rose encircled by thorny vines, this Shield was once owned by Marius Renathyr, a knight-errant destined for a terrible fate.
While holding this Shield, you gain a +2 bonus to AC determined by the Shield's rarity, in addition to the Shield's normal bonus to AC, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Valorous Guard (Rare+)
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add 2 + the Shield's bonus to the creature's AC, potentially causing the attack to miss. When a creature within 5 feet of you fails a Dexterity saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add 2 + the Shield's bonus to the creature's total, potentially causing it to succeed.

entries.name: Honor of the Vanguard (Very Rare+)
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and an ally you can see is within 30 feet of an enemy, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that ally and gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 5 times the Shield's bonus.

entries.name: Righteous Wrath (Very Rare+)
entries: When you use the Valorous Guard property to cause an attack to miss, the next time you hit that attacker with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} before the end of your next turn, it takes an extra {@dice 1d8} (Legendary: {@dice 3d8}) Radiant damage.

item.name: Shield of Marius Renathyr (Legendary)
entries: Crafted from polished gold and white enamel and adorned with an intricate design of a rose encircled by thorny vines, this Shield was once owned by Marius Renathyr, a knight-errant destined for a terrible fate.
While holding this Shield, you gain a +3 bonus to AC determined by the Shield's rarity, in addition to the Shield's normal bonus to AC, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Valorous Guard (Rare+)
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add 2 + the Shield's bonus to the creature's AC, potentially causing the attack to miss. When a creature within 5 feet of you fails a Dexterity saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add 2 + the Shield's bonus to the creature's total, potentially causing it to succeed.

entries.name: Honor of the Vanguard (Very Rare+)
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and an ally you can see is within 30 feet of an enemy, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that ally and gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 5 times the Shield's bonus.

entries.name: Righteous Wrath (Very Rare+)
entries: When you use the Valorous Guard property to cause an attack to miss, the next time you hit that attacker with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} before the end of your next turn, it takes an extra {@dice 1d8} (Legendary: {@dice 3d8}) Radiant damage.

entries.name: As Terrible as the Dawn (Legendary)
entries: You can cast {@spell Flame Strike|XPHB} (save DC 19) from the Shield. If you are in the spell's area, you regain {@dice 5d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} instead of taking damage. Once the spell is cast from the Shield, it can't be cast from it again until the next dusk.

item.name: Shovel of Yorgrim (Rare)
entries: This shovel features a steel blade and collar at the end of a makeshift walking stick, appearing old and well-used. It was once the shovel of Yorgrim of the Shadestone Clan, who could commune with the spirits of the dead. It occasionally emits a faint whispering sound when handled.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the shovel, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Death-Kenning (Rare+)
entries: When you hit an Undead with the shovel, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} immediately after the hit to learn its {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances}, {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}, and {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerabilities}, if any.

entries.name: Deathspeaker (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} and {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} from the shovel.

item.name: Shovel of Yorgrim (Very Rare)
entries: This shovel features a steel blade and collar at the end of a makeshift walking stick, appearing old and well-used. It was once the shovel of Yorgrim of the Shadestone Clan, who could commune with the spirits of the dead. It occasionally emits a faint whispering sound when handled.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the shovel, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Death-Kenning (Rare+)
entries: When you hit an Undead with the shovel, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} immediately after the hit to learn its {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances}, {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}, and {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerabilities}, if any.

entries.name: Deathspeaker (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} and {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} from the shovel.

entries.name: Deny Death's Touch (Very Rare+)
entries: You and your allies within a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

item.name: Shovel of Yorgrim (Legendary)
entries: This shovel features a steel blade and collar at the end of a makeshift walking stick, appearing old and well-used. It was once the shovel of Yorgrim of the Shadestone Clan, who could commune with the spirits of the dead. It occasionally emits a faint whispering sound when handled.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the shovel, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Death-Kenning (Rare+)
entries: When you hit an Undead with the shovel, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} immediately after the hit to learn its {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances}, {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}, and {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerabilities}, if any.

entries.name: Deathspeaker (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} and {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} from the shovel.

entries.name: Deny Death's Touch (Very Rare+)
entries: You and your allies within a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Bind Deathly Servant (Legendary)
entries: When a Humanoid dies within 30 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to turn its soul into a {@creature Specter|XMM} that obeys your commands. If the Humanoid was {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you when it died, you can turn the soul into a {@creature Wraith|XMM} instead. You can control one creature at a time with this property. The Undead disappears after 8 hours, when you create a new creature with this property, or when it dies.

entries.name: Psychopomp (Legendary)
entries: As a {@variantrule Magic|XPHB} action, you and one willing creature that isn't Undead that you touch become wraithlike until the end of your next turn. While wraithlike, you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. If you end your turn inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take {@damage 1d10} Force damage. If the creature you touch is Undead, it must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to all damage until the start of your next turn. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood (Rare)
entries: This twisted wooden staff is crowned by a trinket-adorned deer's skull. It was fashioned by Farryn before she delved into the dark lore of Gorthos. Soft, fragrant moss and earthy mushrooms grow along the staff's length.

While holding the staff, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the staff's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Living Ward (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Servant of the Cycle (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB} (level 3 version) from the staff. When you do so, the next time you hit with an attack before the end of your next turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood (Very Rare)
entries: This twisted wooden staff is crowned by a trinket-adorned deer's skull. It was fashioned by Farryn before she delved into the dark lore of Gorthos. Soft, fragrant moss and earthy mushrooms grow along the staff's length.

While holding the staff, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the staff's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Living Ward (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Servant of the Cycle (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB} (level 3 version) from the staff. When you do so, the next time you hit with an attack before the end of your next turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Cycle's Balance (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Revivify|XPHB} from the staff. When you do so, the next time a creature fails a saving throw against a spell you cast in the next hour, it and creatures of your choice within 20 feet of it take {@damage 4d10} Necrotic damage. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sacrifice of Flesh (Very Rare+)
entries: When a spell you cast restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take Necrotic damage up to twice the level of the spell that can't be reduced or prevented in any way. If you do so, the target regains additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times the damage you take.

item.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood (Legendary)
entries: This twisted wooden staff is crowned by a trinket-adorned deer's skull. It was fashioned by Farryn before she delved into the dark lore of Gorthos. Soft, fragrant moss and earthy mushrooms grow along the staff's length.

While holding the staff, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the staff's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries: You can cast {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB} (level 3 version) from the staff. entries: You can cast {@spell Revivify|XPHB} from the staff. When you do so, the next time a creature fails a saving throw against a spell you cast in the next hour, it and creatures of your choice within 20 feet of it take {@damage 4d10} Necrotic damage. entries: When a spell you cast restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take Necrotic damage up to twice the level of the spell that can't be reduced or prevented in any way. If you do so, the target regains additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times the damage you take.

entries.name: Death Blossom (Legendary)
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you dies, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make flowers bloom around them. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the dead creature regain {@dice 4d8} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and gain {@dice 2d8} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Sword of the Crimson Abbot (Rare)
entries: This powerful, fiendish sword was once wielded by the Crimson Abbot. While it was created as a gift that brought evil and malice to the corrupted former knight, it has lost its connections to the Crimson Rose. However, its evil origins still linger within. The sword is sleek and polished, with a blade that absorbs light. A blood-red ruby on the hilt is fitted within a setting of thorns and roses.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by the sword's rarity. While holding the sword, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Blood Drain (Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the sword, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage.

item.name: Sword of the Crimson Abbot (Very Rare)
entries: This powerful, fiendish sword was once wielded by the Crimson Abbot. While it was created as a gift that brought evil and malice to the corrupted former knight, it has lost its connections to the Crimson Rose. However, its evil origins still linger within. The sword is sleek and polished, with a blade that absorbs light. A blood-red ruby on the hilt is fitted within a setting of thorns and roses.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by the sword's rarity. While holding the sword, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Blood Drain (Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the sword, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Irresistible Hunger (Very Rare+)
entries: Necrotic damage you deal ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

entries.name: Vampiric Charm (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Charm Person|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the sword's bonus, no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from the sword. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Sword of the Crimson Abbot (Legendary)
entries: This powerful, fiendish sword was once wielded by the Crimson Abbot. While it was created as a gift that brought evil and malice to the corrupted former knight, it has lost its connections to the Crimson Rose. However, its evil origins still linger within. The sword is sleek and polished, with a blade that absorbs light. A blood-red ruby on the hilt is fitted within a setting of thorns and roses.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by the sword's rarity. While holding the sword, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Blood Drain (Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the sword, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Irresistible Hunger (Very Rare+)
entries: Necrotic damage you deal ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

entries.name: Vampiric Charm (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Charm Person|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the sword's bonus, no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from the sword. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Embrace of the Duchess (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the sword to the body of a Humanoid that has been dead for 1 minute or less. The creature must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw (as if it were alive) or become a {@creature Vampire Spawn|XMM} that dies again at dawn. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Stolen Life (Legendary)
entries: When you deal Necrotic damage with the Blood Drain property, you can expend and roll one {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Points Die}. You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled plus the Necrotic damage dealt.

item.name: Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan (Rare)
entries: This tooth is razor sharp and can be wielded as a Dagger. Its "hilt" is wrapped in alligator hide, and the flat of its blade flickers with magenta hex magic in carved glyphs.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the tooth, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can force one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the tooth's bonus). On a failed save, the target is jinxed for 1 minute. While jinxed, when the target makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and rolls an even number on the {@dice d20}, it must reroll the {@dice d20} and take the new roll. On a successful save, you must make the same saving throw, becoming jinxed for 1 minute on a failure. This property can't be used again while another creature is jinxed by it.

item.name: Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan (Very Rare)
entries: This tooth is razor sharp and can be wielded as a Dagger. Its "hilt" is wrapped in alligator hide, and the flat of its blade flickers with magenta hex magic in carved glyphs.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the tooth, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can force one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the tooth's bonus). On a failed save, the target is jinxed for 1 minute. While jinxed, when the target makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and rolls an even number on the {@dice d20}, it must reroll the {@dice d20} and take the new roll. On a successful save, you must make the same saving throw, becoming jinxed for 1 minute on a failure. This property can't be used again while another creature is jinxed by it.

entries.name: Exposed Weak Spot (Very Rare+)
entries: When you make an attack roll with the tooth, you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Steal Unluck (Very Rare+)
entries: When an enemy you can see within 60 feet of you makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to negate their {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until a creature you can see makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20}, or until the next dusk.

item.name: Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan (Legendary)
entries: This tooth is razor sharp and can be wielded as a Dagger. Its "hilt" is wrapped in alligator hide, and the flat of its blade flickers with magenta hex magic in carved glyphs.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the tooth, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can force one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the tooth's bonus). On a failed save, the target is jinxed for 1 minute. While jinxed, when the target makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and rolls an even number on the {@dice d20}, it must reroll the {@dice d20} and take the new roll. On a successful save, you must make the same saving throw, becoming jinxed for 1 minute on a failure. This property can't be used again while another creature is jinxed by it.

entries.name: Exposed Weak Spot (Very Rare+)
entries: When you make an attack roll with the tooth, you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Steal Unluck (Very Rare+)
entries: When an enemy you can see within 60 feet of you makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to negate their {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until a creature you can see makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20}, or until the next dusk.

entries.name: Strange Fortunes (Legendary)
entries: Each time you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with the tooth against an enemy, the tooth gains a cumulative +3 bonus to damage rolls. This bonus is in addition to the bonus based on the tooth's rarity. When you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll with the tooth, you take Force damage equal to the accumulated bonus. This property's damage bonus returns to +0 when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

item.name: Veil of the Weeping Widow (Rare)
entries: This mourning veil is imbued with alien power. The Weeping Widow wore the veil to hide her permanently tear-stained face, and rumors circulate that the widow used it to hide the otherworldly corruption writhing within her eyes.
While wearing the veil, you gain a +1 bonus to Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws determined by the veil's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Psychic Fortitude (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

entries.name: Sense Grief (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the veil's bonus) from the veil.

item.name: Veil of the Weeping Widow (Very Rare)
entries: This mourning veil is imbued with alien power. The Weeping Widow wore the veil to hide her permanently tear-stained face, and rumors circulate that the widow used it to hide the otherworldly corruption writhing within her eyes.
While wearing the veil, you gain a +2 bonus to Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws determined by the veil's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Psychic Fortitude (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

entries.name: Sense Grief (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the veil's bonus) from the veil.

entries.name: Psychic Shock (Very Rare+)
entries: When a creature forces you to make a saving throw against Psychic damage, or to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deal {@damage 2d8} Psychic damage to it.

entries.name: Thought Worm (Very Rare+)
entries: You can use the veil to cast {@spell Modify Memory|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the veil's bonus). When a creature fails its saving throw against the spell, you can implant a parasitic spawn of the White Worm in the target's brain. While you're on the same plane, you know the distance and direction to the target, and you can cast Divination and Enchantment spells on it as if it were in range and in sight. A Greater Restoration or {@spell Heal|XPHB} spell kills the parasite and ends this effect. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Veil of the Weeping Widow (Legendary)
entries: This mourning veil is imbued with alien power. The Weeping Widow wore the veil to hide her permanently tear-stained face, and rumors circulate that the widow used it to hide the otherworldly corruption writhing within her eyes.
While wearing the veil, you gain a +3 bonus to Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws determined by the veil's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Psychic Fortitude (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

entries.name: Sense Grief (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the veil's bonus) from the veil.

entries.name: Psychic Shock (Very Rare+)
entries: When a creature forces you to make a saving throw against Psychic damage, or to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deal {@damage 2d8} Psychic damage to it.

entries.name: Thought Worm (Very Rare+)
entries: You can use the veil to cast {@spell Modify Memory|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the veil's bonus). When a creature fails its saving throw against the spell, you can implant a parasitic spawn of the White Worm in the target's brain. While you're on the same plane, you know the distance and direction to the target, and you can cast Divination and Enchantment spells on it as if it were in range and in sight. A Greater Restoration or {@spell Heal|XPHB} spell kills the parasite and ends this effect. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Psychic Storm (Legendary)
entries: You can take one extra {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} during a round, which you can only use to activate the Psychic Shock property.

entries.name: Veiled Countenance (Legendary)
entries: When you are the target of a Divination spell, the caster must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the caster takes {@damage 6d8} Psychic damage and has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the caster's turns, it repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

item.name: Visage of the Old Ways (Rare)
entries: This wood-carved mask has a haunted expression and makes the wearer's eyes look like empty shadows. Rabbit ears protrude over the head. While you wear the mask, you hear the whispers of an ancient forest archfey deep within your mind.
While wearing the mask, you gain a +2 bonus to your damage rolls when you deal Fire damage determined by the mask's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Cultic Mask (Rare+)
entries: You can't be targeted by Divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors. Ability checks made to discern your identity have a minimum DC of 25.

entries.name: Fire Within (Rare+)
entries: While you are burning, your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d4} Fire damage. You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to begin or stop burning.

entries.name: Strange Sight (Rare+)
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet, and you can see normally through areas obscured by smoke.

item.name: Visage of the Old Ways (Very Rare)
entries: This wood-carved mask has a haunted expression and makes the wearer's eyes look like empty shadows. Rabbit ears protrude over the head. While you wear the mask, you hear the whispers of an ancient forest archfey deep within your mind.
While wearing the mask, you gain a +4 bonus to your damage rolls when you deal Fire damage determined by the mask's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Cultic Mask (Rare+)
entries: You can't be targeted by Divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors. Ability checks made to discern your identity have a minimum DC of 25.

entries.name: Fire Within (Rare+)
entries: While you are burning, your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d4} Fire damage. You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to begin or stop burning.

entries.name: Strange Sight (Rare+)
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet, and you can see normally through areas obscured by smoke.

entries.name: Mastery of Flame (Very Rare+)
entries: Fire damage you deal ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

entries.name: Sacrificial Flame (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cause a creature you can see with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} that is within 30 feet of you to burst into flame. Its body burns to ash over the next minute, and when a creature {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you starts its turn in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the body, it takes {@damage 2d8} Fire damage. The flame is extinguished if the target regains any {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

item.name: Visage of the Old Ways (Legendary)
entries: This wood-carved mask has a haunted expression and makes the wearer's eyes look like empty shadows. Rabbit ears protrude over the head. While you wear the mask, you hear the whispers of an ancient forest archfey deep within your mind.
While wearing the mask, you gain a +6 bonus to your damage rolls when you deal Fire damage determined by the mask's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Cultic Mask (Rare+)
entries: You can't be targeted by Divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors. Ability checks made to discern your identity have a minimum DC of 25.

entries.name: Fire Within (Rare+)
entries: While you are burning, your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d4} Fire damage. You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to begin or stop burning.

entries.name: Strange Sight (Rare+)
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet, and you can see normally through areas obscured by smoke.

entries.name: Mastery of Flame (Very Rare+)
entries: Fire damage you deal ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

entries.name: Sacrificial Flame (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cause a creature you can see with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} that is within 30 feet of you to burst into flame. Its body burns to ash over the next minute, and when a creature {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you starts its turn in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the body, it takes {@damage 2d8} Fire damage. The flame is extinguished if the target regains any {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Harvest Offering (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend up to 5 {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} to regain a spell slot of a level equal to the number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} spent. Alternatively, you can touch a creature that is willing or that has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition and force them to expend any number of these {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB} in your place. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Whistle of the Vagrant (Rare)
entries: This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.
While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a +1 bonus determined by the whistle's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Call the Dead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sense the Undead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} of any material other than iron or lead.

entries.name: Undaunted (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Whistle of the Vagrant (Very Rare)
entries: This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.
While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a +2 bonus determined by the whistle's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Call the Dead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sense the Undead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} of any material other than iron or lead.

entries.name: Undaunted (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Call the Undead (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Banishment|XPHB} against an Undead creature (save DC = 16 + the whistle's bonus) from it. The target always appears in a harmless demiplane resembling the interior of a train. If you maintain the spell for its full duration, the target arrives in an appropriate afterlife. Creatures with Legendary Actions automatically succeed on the saving throw. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Steam Cloud (Very Rare+)
entries: You can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from it. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Touched by Death (Very Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

item.name: Whistle of the Vagrant (Legendary)
entries: This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.
While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a +3 bonus determined by the whistle's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Call the Dead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB} on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sense the Undead (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} of any material other than iron or lead.

entries.name: Undaunted (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Call the Undead (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Banishment|XPHB} against an Undead creature (save DC = 16 + the whistle's bonus) from it. The target always appears in a harmless demiplane resembling the interior of a train. If you maintain the spell for its full duration, the target arrives in an appropriate afterlife. Creatures with Legendary Actions automatically succeed on the saving throw. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Steam Cloud (Very Rare+)
entries: You can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required) from it. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Touched by Death (Very Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Afterlife Express (Legendary)
entries: You can blow the whistle to cast {@spell Ghastly Charge|CrookedMoon24} (takes the form of a ghost train) from it. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Amber Birdcage
entries: This birdcage, shaped from amber, physically replaces your torso while you are attuned to it. When your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} ends, it separates from you, and your torso returns to its previous state. The birdcage has the following properties.

entries.name: Sense Fiends
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can sense the location of Fiends or magical effects created by Fiends within 60 feet of yourself.

entries.name: Capture Fiend
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose one {@status Bloodied|XPHB} Fiend that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. It must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be transformed into an amber songbird and trapped in the birdcage. The songbird is an inert object until removed from the cage and released. You can remove one songbird from the cage as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. If you stop holding the bird, the Fiend reverts to its true form with all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and it is {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you.

entries.name: Consume Songbird
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can consume one amber songbird you are holding. The Fiend dies, and you can either regain one expended spell slot with a level up to half the Fiend's CR, or you can gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Fiend's CR.

entries.name: Amber Curse
entries: You have a -1 penalty to Wisdom saving throws. Each time you use the Capture Fiend or Consume Songbird properties, this penalty increases by 1.

item.name: Black Candle
entries: This broad, black tallow candle is engraved with arcane symbols. When lit, its smoke is greasy and pungent, and its flame is pale gray, but it never burns down. The candle has the following properties.

entries.name: Word of Flame and Darkness
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can light or extinguish the candle by speaking a command word while within 60 feet of it. It sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius.

entries.name: Witchlight
entries: While you are in the candle's light, you can cast a level 1 or 2 spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast a spell in this way, you can't cast that spell using the candle again for 24 hours, and you must succeed on a DC 0 Constitution saving throw or take Fire damage equal to {@dice 2d6} times the spell's level.

entries.name: Cursed Candle
entries: After you succeed or fail on the saving throw of the Witchlight property, its save DC increases by 2. This increase can't happen again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When the DC is 10 or higher, you also have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

item.name: Bloody Fiddle
entries: This scarlet-lacquered fiddle is warm to the touch, like the heat of fresh blood. Though it looks like it has seen better days, its sound is clear and strong.
While you hold the fiddle, you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Song of Stirred Blood
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can play a lively or stirring tune on the fiddle. Up to six creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and if you have {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} dice, you can expend and roll one to add it to the total. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sanguine Curse
entries: The first time that you play the fiddle after finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you take 1 Slashing damage that ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}. When you use the Song of Stirred Blood property, this Slashing damage increases by 1.

item.name: Chunk of Oozing Fungus
entries: This fist-sized fungal growth is a pallid color, is oozy and lumpy, and frequently fills the air with spores. The fungus has the following properties.

entries.name: Spore Cloud
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can throw the fungus up to 30 feet. The fungus is destroyed and explodes into a cloud of spores in a 30-foot {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point. Each creature other than you in the area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d8} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more also has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. On a successful save, a target takes half damage only.

entries.name: Regrow
entries: You can grow another Chunk of Oozing Fungus by coughing green-black spores into your hand as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. When you do so, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum decreases by 5.

entries.name: Fungal Curse
entries: You have a -1 penalty to Constitution saving throws. This penalty increases by 1 immediately after you succeed or fail on the saving throw from the Regrow property.

item.name: Devilbone Button
entries: This bone button is found on an article of clothing, such as a shirt or coat, and is carved with the tiny image of a devil. It must be attached to clothing that you wear to attune to it. You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws, and it has the following properties.

entries.name: Improbable Luck
entries: When you fail a saving throw while wearing the button, you can choose to succeed instead. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Protective Bone
entries: While wearing the button, your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum increases by 5 + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Diabolic Curse
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, there is a {@chance 1} chance the button is mysteriously missing and your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to it ends. A devil with a CR of your level + 3 or CR 20 (whichever is lower) then becomes your enemy and seeks to destroy you. The GM determines the devil's details. When you use the Improbable Luck property, the chance the button disappears increases by 1.

item.name: Green Ribbon
entries: This green satin ribbon is just long enough to fasten around a person's neck comfortably. It's hard to think why you'd even want to remove it. While you wear the ribbon, you have a +5 bonus to {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}, and it grants the following properties.

entries.name: Instant Attunement
entries: If the ribbon is wrapped around the neck of a dead creature that has been dead no longer than 10 days and wasn't Undead when it died, the creature returns to life as if by a {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB} spell, and it instantly attunes to the ribbon. The creature dies immediately if its {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the ribbon ends or if the ribbon is removed.

entries.name: Ribbon's Mending
entries: When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to immediately regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your level (minimum 1). Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk or until you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}.

entries.name: Curse of the Ribbon
entries: Creatures other than you within 60 feet of you have a -1 penalty to {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Ribbon's Mending property.

item.name: Hypnovulfen Figure
entries: This carved wooden figurine depicts a crooked wolf with large, leering eyes and a wild, toothy maw. While holding the figure, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The figure has the following properties.

entries.name: Hypnovulfen Bite
entries: Your teeth become viciously sharp. You can bite as an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} that deals {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage instead of Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hypnovulfen Eye
entries: While holding the figure, you can cast {@spell Confusion|XPHB} (save DC 14) with it. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Cursed Hunger
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you must succeed on a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw or you can't use the {@action Attack|XPHB} or {@action Magic|XPHB} actions except to use the figure's properties until you hit a creature with a Hypnovulfen Bite attack. When you use the Hypnovulfen Eye property, the DC of this saving throw increases by 2.

item.name: Jinxed Poker Chip
entries: This ceramic poker chip is painted with a crocodile's skull on one side. Hoarse laughter sounds when it flips. While you hold the chip, it grants the following properties.

entries.name: Jinxed Luck
entries: When you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to flip the chip. Roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 4-6, you succeed on the {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} instead. After you use this property, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a 1-5, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sense Cheating
entries: If you have proficiency with a {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}, you automatically succeed on ability checks to know if someone in a game you are playing is cheating.

entries.name: Cursed Coin
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you must succeed on a DC 0 Charisma saving throw or become cursed until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. While cursed, you subtract {@dice 1d6} from {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}. When you use the Jinxed Luck property, the saving throw DC increases by 1.

item.name: Revelry Suit
entries: This bulky suit is made from natural materials, including fur, canvas, and straw. Its mask is exceptionally oversized and shaped into a sun, smiling in an unsettling way. While you wear this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and it grants the following properties.

entries.name: Dancing Dodge
